snippet: The company was not the reluctant victim of a corrupt culture but an aggressive and creative corrupter, investigations show.
abstract: The company was not the reluctant victim of a corrupt culture but an aggressive and creative corrupter, investigations show.
lead_paragraph: An investigative report in The New York Times by David Barstow and Alejandra Xanic von Bertrab, found that Wal-Mart in Mexico, “was not the reluctant victim of a corrupt culture that insisted on bribes as the cost of doing business. Rather, it was an aggressive and creative corrupter, offering large payoffs to get what the law otherwise prohibited.”

headline.main: How Wal-Mart Used Payoffs to Get Its Way in Mexico
